description: Master solving linear equations through step-by-step interactive lessons and practical applications.

lessons.title: Introduction to Linear Equations
lessons.description: Understanding what linear equations are and why they matter

sections.content: A linear equation is an algebraic equation in which each term is either a constant or the product of a constant and a single variable. Linear equations appear everywhere in mathematics, science, and everyday problem-solving.

items: Equations with variables on both sides

lessons.title: One-Step Equations
lessons.description: Solving simple equations using inverse operations

sections.content: One-step equations can be solved using a single operation. The key is to perform the inverse operation to isolate the variable.
Two-step equations require two operations to solve. We follow the reverse order of operations to isolate the variable.
Remember: Undo addition/subtraction first, then undo multiplication/division.

lessons.title: Multi-Step Equations
lessons.description: Solving complex equations with multiple operations

sections.content: Multi-step equations require combining like terms, using the distributive property, and performing multiple inverse operations.

lessons.title: Equations with Variables on Both Sides
lessons.description: Solving equations where the variable appears multiple times

sections.content: When variables appear on both sides of an equation, we need to collect all variable terms on one side before solving.
Linear equations help us solve countless real-world problems, from calculating costs to determining rates and distances.
